results.title: Little voice
results.brief_description: A screen adaptation of Jim Cartwright’s London play, ‘The Rise and Fall of Little Voice’, by Mark Herman that recreates the tale of the silent LV (Little Voice played by Jane Horrocks) in a working-class English town who spends her days in her attic room listening to her late father’s record collection of the great divas like Marilyn Monroe, Judy Garland and Billie Holiday, while at night impersonates the singers in a private performance for her visiting father’s ghost. Her loud mouthed mother, Mari (Brenda Blethyn), a tragicomic figure of drunkenly rowdy proportions is on a constant and painful cruise for new lovers and impossibly trying to ignore her intensely shy daughter. That is until Ray Say (Michael Caine), a local unsuccessful talent agent and Mari’s perceived chance for love, overhears LV in full swing and stunned by her skill begins a desperate process to foster LV into becoming his chance at the big time. Meanwhile, LV meets Billy (Ewan McGregor), an equally shy pigeon-racing telephone engineer and they begin a tentative friendship that stands in quiet contrast to the ambiguity of the kindness she receives from Ray in his grand scheme and motivates a process of self-awakening from her long and anguished silence. When Ray gambles everything to schedule her first public performance in a local seedy night club, books the band and even brings in a big talent agent from London, all seems set for the road to success. That is, perhaps, all but LV.

results.title: Little Tom Thumb (K)
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and Joy Batchelor
results.brief_description: The dream of escaping from poverty and unhappiness comes true when Little Tom Thumb becomes a hero - saving himself and his six big brothers, and returning home with treasure and magic boots. Animation by Harold Whitaker.

results.title: Little Tim and the brave sea captain (K)
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios and Morton Schindel
results.brief_description: This film captures the feel of salt in a seaside village and the rigours of shipboard life through the adventures of Tim, a gallant stowaway. The sweeping power of the wild ocean and angry sky, and a swirl of greens and greys are forcefully projected while lively sea shanties and the call of gulls accent the storytelling. Based on the well known children’s book by Edward Ardizzone.

results.title: Little skills mean a lot
results.brief_description: Leading sports commentator, Sandy Roberts introduces the Australian Football skills and drills film, highlighting the LITTLE things in football which are essential for team success. Skills drills on tackling, smothering, evasion, ball-handling, crumb gathering, kicking to position etc are presented by leading Victorian Junior Coach, Ray ‘Slug’ Jordan and VFL Development Manager, Kevin Sheehan.

results.title: Little people
results.brief_description: A film which explores the political and social issues which surround dwarfism. The film attempts to depict the potential that exists for lack of understanding for those whose physical difference has far-reaching implications in a world constructed according to physical norms.

results.title: Little man - big city
results.creator_credit: MAFILM Pannonia Filmstudio, World Health Organisation, Roman Kunz, Gyula Macskassy and Gyorgy Varnia
results.brief_description: An animated film which dramatises the plight of today’s urban dweller. Shows the city’s relentless assault on the health of its inhabitants. The `little man’ lives in a typical urban centre where poor planning, haphazard design and inadequate health controls have depleted him - emotionally and physically. The film urges united action to make cities healthy and enjoyable places in which to live.
